error.signature: error[E0277]: the trait bound `MyType: Send` is not satisfied

verdict.summary: A type doesn't implement a required trait, commonly Send/Sync for async or Display for formatting.

dead_ends.action: Using unsafe impl Send for MyType {}
dead_ends.why_fails: Lying to the compiler about thread safety causes data races
May require major architectural changes just to avoid a trait bound

workarounds.action: Implement the required trait: impl Send for MyType if the type is actually safe to send
workarounds.how: Only if all fields are Send â€” verify before implementing

workarounds.action: Wrap non-Send types in Arc<Mutex<T>> for shared ownership across threads
workarounds.how: Arc<Mutex<T>> is Send + Sync if T is Send

frequently_confused_with.distinction: '[E0277]' indicates an unsatisfied trait bound, while '[E0507]' indicates moving out of borrowed content.
Both produce similar messages, but 'e0277-trait-not-implemented' and 'e0277-trait-bound' differ in root cause and environment context.
